Pros: Nice icon
Cons: no option to select audio devices to get input and output sounds. My workstation simply has 2 mics for input and 3 speakers for output. I click the recording button, the recording line remains flat, that means there was nothing to record while I was reading off a paragraph.
To the developer: if you publish something and claim that it works, make sure it works. Although just a few basic features, make sure it works. You didn't just waste your time, you also waste our time as well.

What's with the "Too big - 169MB?" It's 66k, I even downloaded it to see..
Always like to check ones where everyone goes "Doesn't even run" but 1 or 2 say it's ok.
I runs on my 20.04, but I did set it's permissions, and had to change my sound settings.
However, besides the mentioned icons there's a menu with a "move to trash, and another seems to mean "do nothing" the other seems to mean "rename" .. maybe the other is "save..." but there is Literally *nothing* else.
Why "voice" recorder.. it just records from the default selected mic... There's no other menus, nadda.. not even min/max/quit.. had to alt-F4 to quit it. I'd almost give it 2 stars since it sorta did what it said, but wow, I have never seen an app with less options.. even my old "Hello, World" apps, usually come with default min/max/quit, about.. but this is barren. Way to trivially functionless to have a point.. why keep calling it "voice recorder" it just straight records from mike, plays back, deletes, and maybe saves. Send to trash" (or whatever) is the only thing anywhere in English.
summary: Well, mic, play, pause, and stop icons are clear.

This is how to find your audio recordings: Right mouse click on the finished recording, Click on 2nd chinese option (means: display in file manager). I found the recordings in: personal folder - snap - deepin-voice-recorder - common. It's a .wav file.
